Message.Title: Greetings From The People's Republic Of Illinois
Message.Msg: We banned firearms in the murder capital Chicago to make the criminals safer. A small samplling follows. Saturday: Three shootings in the city since Friday night have left a 21-year-old man dead and three people hurt, Chicago police said. Friday: Authorities are investigating the shooting death today of a 44-year-old Sauk Village man. Friday: A woman was shot to death while driving a van when someone pulled alongside her on the ramp from Lake Shore Drive to the Stevenson Expressway and fired 10 to 14 times Friday morning, police said. Friday: A 30-year-old man was shot multiple times this afternoon in the Edgewater Beach neighborhood on the North Side. Earlier in the week, but wif a special odor: A teenager arrested minutes after the slaying of a man in the Park Manor neighborhood Tuesday afternoon urinated on his hands while in an interview room after investigators told him a gunshot residue test would be done, prosecutors said today. Nothing on Sunday? We have to wait until they locate the next of kin, you know.

Topic.Title: Cisco System - it's time

Message.Msg: You sure post a lot about Bush. *** He wishes Bush were still in office so we could enjoy the good times of the Bush Goldilocks economy. Ahh... those were the days. And things were great in 1999 during Clinton's reign, until the stock market collapsed in March 2000. The trailing PE of the S&P 500 is currently 17.3 compared to the historical average of about 15.4 since 1871. The 12-month forward PE of the S&P 500 is currently 14.0 versus a historical average of 12.8 since 1976 (the latest date forward earnings estimates are available). Stocks look expensive based on Robert Shiller's PE10 methodology (current 22.4 versus average of 17.3 since 1871) but I believe Shiller's PE10 methodology is fundamentally unsound and is currently underestimating the strength of the Obama recovery. Everywhere I look business activity is accelerating, people are finding great paying jobs with ease and pundits are predicting a decade of rising stock prices. Dow 18,000 by the end of Obama's reign. Forget about Bush. Obama is our saviour. Join the crusade to put Obama on Mt. Rushmore.
